alert.note: Alert for Cheyenne County; Kit Carson County (Colorado) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Goodland (Northwestern Kansas and East Central Colorado)
info.headline: Flood Watch issued June 17 at 2:28AM MDT until June 19 at 6:00PM MDT by NWS Goodland
info.description: ...FLOOD WATCH IN EFFECT FROM THIS AFTERNOON THROUGH THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flash flooding caused by excessive rainfall is possible. * WHERE...Portions of east central Colorado and Kansas, including the following counties, in east central Colorado, Cheyenne and Kit Carson. In Kansas, Gove, Graham, Greeley, Logan, Sheridan, Sherman, Thomas, Wallace and Wichita. * WHEN...From this afternoon through this evening. * IMPACTS...Excessive runoff may result in flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations. Flooding may occur in poor drainage and urban areas. Low-water crossings may be flooded. Storm drains and ditches may become clogged with debris. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - Strong thunderstorms are expected to bring locally heavy rainfall this afternoon and evening, combined with the previous days rainfall, the threat for flash flooding continues. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: You should monitor later forecasts and be prepared to take action should Flash Flood Warnings be issued.
